caseNameFull: Kalovsky, a Minor v. the Meyer Dairy Products Company.

opinions.snippet:
This cause is here on error from the common pleas court of Cuyahoga county, and it is here sought to reverse the verdict of the jury and judgment of the court in favor of defendant, the Meyer Dairy Products Company, a corporation, on the ground, first, that the court erred in permitting a certain map to be offered in evidence; and, second, in instructing the jury upon a special request of the defendant.

court: Supreme Court of the United States

opinions.snippet:
Mr. Justice Murphy,
dissenting:
Our prime concern in this case is whether the criminal sanctions of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act of 1938 plainly and unmistakably apply to the respondent in his capacity as a corporate officer. He is charged with violating § 301 (a) of the Act, which prohibits the introduction or delivery for introduction into interstate commerce of any adulterated or misbranded drug.
